page.title: 03The Town Centre Bridlngton
page.content: The Promenade is one of Bridlington's main shopping streets. Here can be found Boot's the Chemists and a variety of smaller shops, cafes, etc The town's bus station was also on the Promenade but is now a car park. As one moves away from the town centre land use changes to accomodate a bingo hall, bowling green, supermarket and the "Three b's" theatre. Buidings in the town are in the main undistinguished despite a number of old frontages. There are two exceptions, Binn's department store, 4 storeys high, and the 11 storey Ferndale flats near South Cliff Gardens. The other large stores in the town are Woolworth's and Marks & Spencers. Twice weekly in King Street there is an open market of some 40 stalls selling mixed goods.
